metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: jQuery - Set Content and Attributes
Set Content - text(), html(), and val()
We will use the same three methods from the previous page to set content :
content.html: We will use the same three methods from the previous page to set content:

content.text: The following example demonstrates how to set content with the jQuery text() , html() , and val() methods:
content.html: The following example demonstrates how to set content with the jQuery text(), html(), and val() methods:

content.code_html:
$("#btn1").click(function(){
  $("#test1").text("Hello world!");
});
$("#btn2").click(function(){
  $("#test2").html("<b>Hello world!</b>");
});
$("#btn3").click(function(){
  $("#test3").val("Dolly Duck");
});

content.text: A Callback Function for text(), html(), and val()

All of the three jQuery methods above: text() , html() , and val() , also come with a callback function. The callback function has two parameters: the index of the current element in the list of elements selected and the original (old) value. You then return the string you wish to use as the new value from the function.
content.html: All of the three jQuery methods above: text(), html(), and val(), also come with a callback function. The callback function has two parameters: the index of the current element in the list of elements selected and the original (old) value. You then return the string you wish to use as the new value from the function.

content.text: The following example demonstrates text() and html() with a callback function:
content.html: The following example demonstrates text() and html() with a callback function:

content.code_html:
$("#btn1").click(function(){
  $("#test1").text(function(i, origText){
    return "Old text: " + origText + " New text: Hello world!
    (index: " + i + ")";
  });
});

$("#btn2").click(function(){
  $("#test2").html(function(i, origText){
    return "Old html: " + origText + " New html: Hello <b>world!</b>
    (index: " + i + ")";
  });
});

content.text: Set Attributes - attr()
The jQuery attr() method is also used to set/change attribute values.
content.html: The jQuery attr() method is also used to set/change attribute values.

content.text: The following example demonstrates how to change (set) the value of the href attribute in a link:
content.html: The following example demonstrates how to change (set) the value of the href attribute in a link:

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  $("#w3s").attr("href", "https://www.w3schools.com/jquery/");
});

content.text: The attr() method also allows you to set multiple attributes at the same time.
content.html: The attr() method also allows you to set multiple attributes at the same time.

content.text: The following example demonstrates how to set both the href and title attributes at the same time:
content.html: The following example demonstrates how to set both the href and title attributes at the same time:

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  $("#w3s").attr({
    "href" : "https://www.w3schools.com/jquery/",
    "title" : "W3Schools jQuery Tutorial"
  });
});

content.text: A Callback Function for attr()

The jQuery method attr() , also comes with a callback function. The callback function has two parameters: the index of the current element in the list of elements selected and the original (old) attribute value. You then return the string you wish to use as the new attribute value from the function.
content.html: The jQuery method attr(), also comes with a callback function. The callback function has two parameters: the index of the current element in the list of elements selected and the original (old) attribute value. You then return the string you wish to use as the new attribute value from the function.

content.text: The following example demonstrates attr() with a callback function:
content.html: The following example demonstrates attr() with a callback function:

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  $("#w3s").attr("href", function(i, origValue){
    return origValue + "/jquery/";
  });
});

content.text: jQuery Exercises
Test Yourself With Exercises
Exercise:
Use a jQuery method to change the text of a <div> element to "Hello World".
content.html: Use a jQuery method to change the text of a <div> element to "Hello World".

content.code_html: $("div").("");

content.html: For a complete overview of all jQuery HTML methods, please go to our jQuery HTML/CSS Reference.
